Experiment Method.Assay Method: In vitro proteasome assay and amyloid aggregation study

Material used.Material Name: Wildtype and mutant α-synuclein (A30P, E46K, A53T)
Material used.Description: The experiments were conducted using wildtype and mutant α-synuclein proteins subjected to proteolytic cleavage by the 20S proteasome and tested for their ability to form amyloid fibrils.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Missense mutation leading to altered protein behavior
Readout description.Result Description: The A30P mutant showed increased susceptibility to proteasomal cleavage and altered aggregation properties compared to wildtype α-synuclein.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Missense mutation leading to altered protein behavior
Readout description.Result Description: The E46K mutant exhibited reduced proteasomal degradation rates and enhanced amyloid fibril formation.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Missense mutation leading to altered protein behavior
Readout description.Result Description: The A53T mutant displayed increased proteasomal cleavage and enhanced aggregation propensity.

Biological replicates.Description: Number of biological replicates not specified in the literature context.

Technical replicates.Description: Details on technical replicates not provided.

Basic positive control.Description: Wildtype α-synuclein was used as the positive control for comparison.

Basic negative control.Description: No explicit negative control mentioned in the context.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Normal proteasomal cleavage and aggregation behavior as observed in wildtype α-synuclein.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Altered proteasomal cleavage rates or enhanced amyloid fibril formation compared to wildtype.

Approved assay.Explanation: In vitro assays evaluating proteasomal degradation and amyloid aggregation are commonly used in neurodegenerative disease research, including studies on Parkinson's disease.
